info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 5:03PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 503 PM MST /603 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southeast of Walnut Canyon National Monument, or 14 miles southeast of Flagstaff, moving northeast at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Flagstaff, Walnut Canyon National Monument, Canyon Padre Bridge, Marshall Lake, Winona, Cosnino, Angell, Twin Arrows and Upper Lake Mary.
This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 207 and 223.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Pine Grove Campground, Lake View Campground and Lakeview Campground.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT COCONINO COUNTY UNTIL 530 PM MST /630 PM MDT/

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Western Mogollon Rim
